channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Builders rubble, 20th August
item.description:
Mostly bricks & bit of rubble dumped on entrance to footpath in Brockhampton lane going up from level crossing to Swindon Village.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockhampton Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bus stop has a tiny stop number on the metal sign, 20th August
item.description:
The bus stops on The Promenade have a very tiny stop number on the metal plate that is attached to the top of each bus shelter. It is difficult for someone with full sight to see the bus stop number; if someone has poor sight, it is unlikely that they will be able to see the number at all. Could bigger numbers be put on the shelters, please? This would help people who have sight conditions to find their bus stop.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Promenade, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bike rack not fixed, 20th August
item.description:
Previously reported bent bike rack now has safety sign on it but isn't fixed, actually worse than when it was broken!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64a, Tennyson Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Inadequate markings or signage, 20th August
item.description:
At the very end of Finchcroft Lane nearest the cemetery there is space to enable vehicles to turn round. Today there were two vans parked there making the turning incredibly awkward. Can there be some markings or a sign to keep this area clear please. An emergency response vehicle would not be able to turn round when there is a vehicle in the space.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Finchcroft Lane, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Dead fox on pavement, 20th August
item.description:
Fox was hit on hucclecote road and was moved to the pavement. The location is directly opposite 117 hucclecote road - on the other side of the street. If the corner of green lane is behind you and 117 is on the left then the fox is on the right on the green area on the side of the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lane, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees) problem, 20th August
item.description:
A large wooden placard has been erected on the roadside, right on a bend by the bridge. It’s a dangerous distraction for drivers — I’ve already seen a near-collision where one car drifted wide while another came down the hill. The sign shouldn’t be in such a prominent position and definitely not as a permanent fixture.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees)
